author: booktoken
title: NFT Books - Book Token Platform
description: By 2023, the world will have 1.11 billion people who read eBooks, but none of them own these digital books, and therefore there is no secondary market for eBooks or audiobooks.

f6_assessments.q0:
The current digital publishing industry is an industry based on a licensed access model rather than a digital ownership model, this means that when a reader "buys" an eBook or Audiobook from any retailer (e.g. Amazon Kindle ) does not actually purchase the digital book but a license to view its content, which can be revoked at any time by the reseller, publisher or author. Another problem highlighted by the proposal is that centralized retailers such as Amazon report only sales data and revenue to publishers / authors making the distribution process of a book not transparent and difficult to verify. Finally, readers are not allowed the opportunity to resell or exchange purchased digital books, which however happens with paper books, which are exchanged in second-hand markets without generating income for the artist, who sees his intellectual property resold without having a profit.
The proposal therefore aims to create a makteplace for NFTs and eBooks and audiobooks where readers/indepedent authors/publishers can buy/sell/publish unique digital book assets, which they truly own. This will allow authors and publishers to receive perpetual percentages from resale in secondary markets as well as greater security and digital rights management. Readers will truly own what they buy and will be able to earn BOOK tokens by consuming the contents of the books. The verified reading and the historical record of consumption could also radically change the eudcative system.
The proposal responds perfectly to the objectives of the challenge, in fact it aims to build a decentralized application that is configured as an excellent alternative to traditional centralized digital book retailers (e.g. Amazon kindle). The gain for the Cardano network is evident, eBook revenue is expected to reach $ 13.62 billion in 2022, with a total of 1.1232 billion readers by 2027 (https://www.statista.com/outlook/dmo/digital -media / epublishing / ebooks / worldwide) without considering the potential value of the secondary market.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team, whose Linkedin references are provided, has a confirmed and rooted experience in the sector, they have already created and sold an ebook platform (Bookshout) by collaborating with important companies such as Google, Microsoft, WSJ etc.
The proponent provides banking (Silicon Valley Bank), legal (Morrison Foerster), accounting and tax (Deloitte) references. All high-level references.
The proponent provides the link to his own medium article in which he explains the basic technical aspects such as architecture and the technologies used.
The MVP (minimum functional product) has already been created. The BookToken team used blockchain infrastructure along with smart contracts and decentralized storage to create unique, decentralized and even fully encrypted (DEA) digital book assets, all stored on the blockchain without the need for centralized databases. This will allow the true ownership of books and digital media without publicly displaying the contents of the NFT on the blockchain itself. (This video can help you understand better: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=14Bh8hjVLIg&feature=emb_logo).
Then the owner of the NFT will be able to read the book with the browser-based anonymous open EReader without the need to log in once their wallet is connected.
The development stages of the platform and reader functions will follow (possibility of transferring book between wallets, exchange of basic books, release of the book and mobile app) which are described in detail and with precise timing.
Consuming the contents of the books will also give the opportunity to earn $ BOOK tokens, which can be exchanged or used to purchase books.
The proposer shows awareness of any risks that could jeopardize the success of the proposal, for this he employs several law firms to help navigate editorial contracts, NFT transactional legality in the United States and abroad, and tax law for a secondary market that has never been existed.
The team is not engaged in any other proposals in this fund nor in previous funds which gives them the opportunity to focus 100% on the realization of the proposal and reportedly have 8 publishers ready and thousands of titles ready to go to sell NFT books .
Considering the above, I consider it extremely likely that the proposal will be successfully implemented

This is due to the difficulty of implementing decentralized digital ownership with an eBook, compared to physical books, which have a secondary market in the real world. By using NFT technology to develop a simple platform on Cardano, it is now possible to create a digital book ownership model that will aid in bringing in hundreds of millions of readers and billions of dollars' worth of digital assets. By developing a dApp e-Book that can use NFT ownership over each book, consumers may now own, rather than license, their digital books and can resale them in an open market with royalties going directly to artists and publishers. This will also encourage broader adoption within the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a very well written proposal that clearly defines the Booktoken project and the subsequent impact of directing larger adoption towards the Cardano blockchain.

The Booktoken team proposes an end to end solution for eBook readers, audio book listeners, authors and publishers by using Cardano eBook and audio NFTs with smart contracted royalty allowances facilitated by a marketplace. It also incorporates a unique “read to earn” model.

Of all projects bringing smart contract NFTs and all their capabilities into real life use cases, this has to have one of the biggest potentials. It provides practical solutions to problems existing in a very large established industry. The solutions will definitely result in Booktoken taking market share from exploitative and monopolized institutions and potentially onboard millions into the Cardano community through decentralized ownership of NFT ebooks and audio-books.

The project opens doors to numerous possibilities through the minting of e-books and audio-books as smart contract capable NFTs:  purchasers actually owning resale rights to their e-books and audio-books; publishers and authors receiving royalties in perpetuity on subsequent sales; connecting authors and publishers with readers directly; facilitating legal requirements and marketing strategies; as well as many other creative ways of using Cardano NFTs.
f6_assessments.q1: The Booktoken team has laid out a clear roadmap with timetables and performance indicators that attest to their experience in business and the industry. Their core team brings accomplished leadership, marketing, programming (Haskell) and legal expertise. The breakdowns in terms of time table and budget are detailed and realistic and very reasonable for a project of this magnitude. Considering the potential of this project I think the ability to pull this off with the amount of funding requested would create a lot of bang for the buck for Cardano's Project Catalyst program.
f6_assessments.q2:
The project has clearly defined KPIs which the team will update at the end of every month making this an easily auditable proposal. Many of the KPIs being straight up usage of Cardano's smart contract NFTs. 

Booktoken is committed to creating an entire marketplace with all of the legal and technological requirements for authors, publishers, readers and resellers of NFT based eBooks and audio books. Their measurable success has the potential to really showcase what Cardano's smart contract and blockchain technology can do when creative entrepreneurs apply it to an existing industry. With distinct monthly and quarterly benchmarks, following Booktoken's success will become synonymous with Cardano's success in real world applications.

f6_assessments.q0: Book Token has a clear problem which they are trying to solve.  I buy a lot of eBooks, but I don't really own the digital books I have bought. Publishers have the incentive of allowing eBooks to be resold as they would get royalties from secondary market sales. eBooks and audio books are a huge industry and it would be great to bring this to Cardano. The team is very ambitious and they hope to be one of the biggest dApps on Cardano. This could be great for onboarding new people to the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: The overview of this proposal is quite easy to understand, it stands out from the traditional online reading market in that when readers consume their books, they will be rewarded in $BOOK of the team's native token, which is a reading system to earn money. In the beginning, the team created DEA - Decentralized Digital Assets along with NFT metadata that provide instructions on how to store both public information and encrypted private IPs. f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility, first of all, in the description of the plan, the team gives the stages and timeline for completing the work, but they do not clearly explain the required tasks and the final products. About the team members, including Joshua Stone, CEO & Co-Founder; Ben Illian, Co-Founder; RJ Regenold, CTO; Bob Wright, Chief Legal Officer and Stakeholders. f6_assessments.q2: From influence, feasibility to auditability, it seems that the new team is just stopping at making an outline of the things to do for the project. In describing the success of the project, the team thinks that if there are eight publishers and thousands of titles, ready to go to sell NFT Books and attract hundreds of millions of readers into an easy-to-use platform that allows they end up owning and reading their digital book then the project accomplishes its goal.
